thread.title: Hokkaido bullet train to be launched next year
thread.title_full: Hokkaido bullet train to be launched next year

title: Hokkaido bullet train to be launched next year
text:
Hokkaido bullet train to be launched next year 16 Sep 2015 at 19:59 701 viewed 0 comments Jump in Thai tourists to Japan SAPPORO - A shinkansen bullet train line will open on March 26, 2016 linking the northern main island of Hokkaido with Tokyo and other stations on the Honshu mainland, railway operators said Wednesday. 
Hokkaido Railway Co and East Japan Railway Co will provide 13 round-trips per day on the Hokkaido shinkansen line, launching the first ever bullet train service to Hokkaido. 
Osamu Shimada (left), president of Hokkaido Railway Co, attends a press conference in Sapporo, northern Japan, on Wednesday to announce that the Hokkaido shinkansen bullet train line will open on March 26, 2016. (Kyodo photo) 
"We will put full efforts into starting the operation safely," said Osamu Shimada, president of Hokkaido Railway, adding that the railway operators hope passengers using the line will benefit all of Hokkaido. 
Of the 13 round-trips, 10 will employ trains connecting Hakodate in southern Hokkaido and Tokyo in four hours and 10 minutes at the fastest. 
One round-trip will be covered by a train connecting Hakodate with Sendai, while trains will be employed for the remaining two round-trips linking Hakodate to Aomori in Aomori prefecture and Morioka in Iwate prefecture.
